title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate consumer surplus as $24 and/or does not show the work.

Consumer Surplus = Marginal Benefit−Price =   $30−6 = $24 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6888@

The response calculates consumer surplus as $24 and shows the work.

Consumer Surplus = Marginal Benefit−Price =   $30−6 = $24 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6888@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify that 4 sandwiches and 2 units of Good E will maximize Polina’s total benefit given her weekly income of $24 and/or does not explain that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good E (10) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of sandwiches (10), or

M B Good E Pric e Good E = M B Sandwich Pric e Sandwich MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6146@

$30 $3 = $60 $6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CC@

10=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D0C@

The response identifies that 4 sandwiches and 2 units of Good E will maximize Polina’s total benefit given her weekly income of $24 and explains that for the last unit of each good consumed the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of Good E (10) is equal to the ratio of the marginal benefit to the price of sandwiches (10), or

M B Good E Pric e Good E = M B Sandwich Pric e Sandwich MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6146@

$30 $3 = $60 $6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41CC@

10=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D0C@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Polina would not be able to buy 4 sandwiches and 3 units of Good E and/or does not explain that her total expenditures would be $30 (=$3×4+$6×3) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44E1@ , which is greater than her weekly income of $28.

The response states that no, Polina would not be able to buy 4 sandwiches and 3 units of Good E and explains that her total expenditures would be $30 (=$3×4+$6×3) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44E1@ , which is greater than her weekly income of $28.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify that Good E and Good Y are substitutes and/or does not explain that the cross-price elasticity of demand is positive because an 8% increase in the price of Good E led to a 4% increase in the demand for Good Y.

The response identifies that Good E and Good Y are substitutes and explains that the cross-price elasticity of demand is positive because an 8% increase in the price of Good E led to a 4% increase in the demand for Good Y.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the quantity of sandwiches that will maximize Polina’s total benefit will increase and/or does not explain that a decrease in the price of an input to the production of sandwiches would increase the supply of sandwiches, which would decrease the price of sandwiches and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent for each additional unit consumed.

The response states that the quantity of sandwiches that will maximize Polina’s total benefit will increase and explains that a decrease in the price of an input to the production of sandwiches would increase the supply of sandwiches, which would decrease the price of sandwiches and increase the marginal benefit per dollar spent for each additional unit consumed.
